nexttext:
\begin{defi}[case $\sigma = -$]
We call backward finite differences embedding denoted by $FDE-$ the definition of the following elements: the application
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\forall k=0,...,N,\;\;t_{k}=a+kh." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>∀</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: and the discrete operator
prevtext:
\begin{defi}[case $\sigma = -$]
We call backward finite differences embedding denoted by $FDE-$ the definition of the following elements: the application
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\mbox{disc}}:&{\mathcal{C}^{0}([a,b],{\mathbb{R}}^{d})}%
&\longrightarrow&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{d}\right)^{N+1}}\\
&{q}&\longmapsto&{(q(t_{k}))_{k=0,...,N}}\end{array}," display="block"><mrow><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mtext>disc</mtext><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><msup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒞</mi><mn>0</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mi>q</mi></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: and the discrete operator
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\Delta_{-}}:&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{d}\right)^{N+1}}&%
\longrightarrow&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{d}\right)^{N}}\\
&{Q=(Q_{k})_{k=0,...,N}}&\longmapsto&{\left(\frac{Q_{k}-Q_{k-1}}{h}\right)_{k=%
1,..,N}.}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>-</mo></msub><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>N</mi></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mi>h</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\Delta_{+}}:&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{d}\right)^{N+1}}&%
\longrightarrow&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{d}\right)^{N}}\\
&{Q=(Q_{k})_{k=0,...,N}}&\longmapsto&{\left(\frac{Q_{k}-Q_{k+1}}{h}\right)_{k=%
0,..,N-1}.}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>+</mo></msub><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>N</mi></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mi>h</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

nexttext:
where $O$ is a differential operator shaped as $O = \sum_{i} f_i (\cdot) (d/dt)^i \circ g_i (\cdot) $
where $f_i$, $g_i$ are functions. Then, the direct discrete embedding of \eqref{edo} is \eqref{edoh} the system of equations of unknown $q^h \in ({\mathbb{R}}^d)^{m_1}$ given by:
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}O(q)=0," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
where $O$ is a differential operator shaped as $O = \sum_{i} f_i (\cdot) (d/dt)^i \circ g_i (\cdot) $
where $f_i$, $g_i$ are functions. Then, the direct discrete embedding of \eqref{edo} is \eqref{edoh} the system of equations of unknown $q^h \in ({\mathbb{R}}^d)^{m_1}$ given by:
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}O^{h}(q^{h})=0," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mi>O</mi><mi>h</mi></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>q</mi><mi>h</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: Then, the direct discrete embedding of \eqref{ne} with respect to $FDE-$ is \eqref{ned} the system of equations of unknown $Q \in ({\mathbb{R}}^d)^{N+1}$ given by:
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex7.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}\forall t\in[a,b],\;\;\ddot{q}(t)+\dot{q}(t)+q(t)=0." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>∀</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>∈</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>q</mi><mo>¨</mo></mover><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>q</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: Then, the direct discrete embedding of \eqref{ne} with respect to $FDE-$ is \eqref{ned} the system of equations of unknown $Q \in ({\mathbb{R}}^d)^{N+1}$ given by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex8.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}\forall k=2,...,N,\;\;{\displaystyle}\frac{Q_{k}-2Q_{k-1}+Q_{k-2}}{h^{2}}+{%
\displaystyle}\frac{Q_{k}-Q_{k-1}}{h}+Q_{k}=0." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>∀</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mi>h</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $L$ is a Lagrangian i.e. a $\mathcal{C}^{2}$ application defined by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex9.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\mathcal{L}}:&{\mathcal{C}^{2}([a,b],{\mathbb{R}}^{d})}%
&\longrightarrow&{{\mathbb{R}}}\\
&{q}&\longmapsto&{{\displaystyle}\int_{a}^{b}L(q(t),\dot{q}(t),t)dt}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><msup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒞</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mi>ℝ</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mi>q</mi></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msubsup><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>q</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

prevtext: where $L$ is a Lagrangian i.e. a $\mathcal{C}^{2}$ application defined by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex10.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{L}:&{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}\times{\mathbb{R}}^{d}\times[a,b]}%
&\longrightarrow&{{\mathbb{R}}}\\
&{(x,v,t)}&\longmapsto&{L(x,v,t).}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>×</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>×</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mi>ℝ</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>v</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>v</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}\forall t\in]a,b[,\;\;{\displaystyle}\frac{\partial L}{\partial x}(q(t),\dot%
{q}(t),t)-\frac{d}{dt}\left(\frac{\partial L}{\partial v}(q(t),\dot{q}(t),t)%
\right)=0." display="block"><mrow><mo>∀</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>∈</mo><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>q</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>q</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>q</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>q</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\frac{\partial L}{\partial x}(Q,-\sigma\Delta_{\sigma}Q,\tau)+\sigma\Delta_{%
\sigma}\left(\frac{\partial L}{\partial v}(Q,-\sigma\Delta_{\sigma}Q,\tau)%
\right)=0,\;\;Q\in({\mathbb{R}}^{d})^{N+1}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>τ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>τ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>∈</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext:
\begin{prrop}\label{dlf}
Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a Lagrangian functional associated to a Lagrangian $L$. The discrete Lagrangian functional associated to $\mathcal{L}$ with respect to $Gauss$-$FDE\sigma$ is given by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex12.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\xymatrix@R=2cm@C=2.5cm{{\displaystyle}\int_{a}^{b}\dot{q}(t)dt=q(b)-q(a)%
\qquad\ar[r]^{Gauss\text{-}FDE\sigma}&\qquad h{\displaystyle}\sum_{k\in I_{%
\sigma}}(-\sigma\Delta_{\sigma}Q)_{k}=Q_{N}-Q_{0}.}" display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\xymatrix</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">@</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">@</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msubsup><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>q</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true">  </mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\ar</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>r</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>-</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>F</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>E</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>σ</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">&</mi></mrow><mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true">  </mo><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>k</mi></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>N</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
\begin{prrop}\label{dlf}
Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a Lagrangian functional associated to a Lagrangian $L$. The discrete Lagrangian functional associated to $\mathcal{L}$ with respect to $Gauss$-$FDE\sigma$ is given by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex13.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\mathcal{L}^{\sigma}_{h}}:&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{d}%
\right)^{N+1}}&\longrightarrow&{{\mathbb{R}}}\\
&{Q=(Q_{k})_{k=0,...,N}}&\longmapsto&{h\displaystyle\sum_{k\in I_{\sigma}}L(Q_%
{k},(-\sigma\Delta_{\sigma}Q)_{k},t_{k}).}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mi>h</mi><mi>σ</mi></msubsup><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mi>ℝ</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex14.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}\frac{\partial L}{\partial x}(Q,-\sigma\Delta_{\sigma}Q,\tau)-\sigma\Delta_{%
-\sigma}\left(\frac{\partial L}{\partial v}(Q,-\sigma\Delta_{\sigma}Q,\tau)%
\right)=0,\;\;Q\in({\mathbb{R}}^{d})^{N+1}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>τ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>σ</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>τ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>∈</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext:
~\\
\noindent Thus, a coherent discrete embedding provides a direct discrete version of a Lagrangian system preserving its Lagrangian structure. \\

\noindent The previous study leads to a default of coherence of $Gauss$-$FDE\sigma$. Indeed, algorithms obtained by direct discrete embedding \eqref{dd} and obtained by discrete variational principle \eqref{elh} do not coincide. The problem is to understand \textit{why there is not asymmetry appearing in the direct discrete embedding?} It seems that we miss dynamical informations in the formulation of Lagrangian systems at the continuous level which are pointed up in the discrete space with the asymmetric discrete operators $\left( -\sigma \Delta_{\sigma} \right)_{\sigma = \pm}$. Nevertheless, this default of coherence can be corrected using a different writing of the initial Euler-Lagrange equation. 

\subsection{Rewriting of the Euler-Lagrange equation and discrete embeddings}\label{section24}
The usual way to derive differential equations in Physics is to built a continuous model using discrete data. However, this process gives only an information in one direction of time. As a consequence, a discrete evaluation of the velocity corresponds in general at the continuous level to the evaluation of the right or left derivative. In general, we replace the right (or left) derivative by the classical derivative $d/dt$. However, this procedure assumes that the underlying solution is differentiable. This assumption is not only related to the regularity of the solutions but also to the reversibility of the systems (the right and left derivatives are equal). In this section, we introduce asymmetric Lagrangian systems which are obtained with functionals depending only on left or only on right derivatives. We prove in this case that $Gauss$-$FDE\sigma$ is coherent. 

\begin{defi}
For $f : [a,b] \longrightarrow {\mathbb{R}} ^d $ smooth enough function, we denote:
mathml: \xymatrix⁢@⁢R=2⁢c⁢m⁢@⁢C=4⁢c⁢m⁢Lagrangian functional\ar⁢[r] Functional discretization ⁢\ar⁢[d] Variational principle ⁢&⁢Discrete Lag. functional\ar⁢[d] Discr. var. principle ⁢Euler-Lagrange equation\ar⁢[r] Direct discrete embdedding ⁢\ar⁢@/2.2⁢c⁢m/[r] Variational integrator ⁢&⁢Numerical scheme

\noindent Thus, a coherent discrete embedding provides a direct discrete version of a Lagrangian system preserving its Lagrangian structure. \\

\noindent The previous study leads to a default of coherence of $Gauss$-$FDE\sigma$. Indeed, algorithms obtained by direct discrete embedding \eqref{dd} and obtained by discrete variational principle \eqref{elh} do not coincide. The problem is to understand \textit{why there is not asymmetry appearing in the direct discrete embedding?} It seems that we miss dynamical informations in the formulation of Lagrangian systems at the continuous level which are pointed up in the discrete space with the asymmetric discrete operators $\left( -\sigma \Delta_{\sigma} \right)_{\sigma = \pm}$. Nevertheless, this default of coherence can be corrected using a different writing of the initial Euler-Lagrange equation. 

\subsection{Rewriting of the Euler-Lagrange equation and discrete embeddings}\label{section24}
The usual way to derive differential equations in Physics is to built a continuous model using discrete data. However, this process gives only an information in one direction of time. As a consequence, a discrete evaluation of the velocity corresponds in general at the continuous level to the evaluation of the right or left derivative. In general, we replace the right (or left) derivative by the classical derivative $d/dt$. However, this procedure assumes that the underlying solution is differentiable. This assumption is not only related to the regularity of the solutions but also to the reversibility of the systems (the right and left derivatives are equal). In this section, we introduce asymmetric Lagrangian systems which are obtained with functionals depending only on left or only on right derivatives. We prove in this case that $Gauss$-$FDE\sigma$ is coherent. 

\begin{defi}
For $f : [a,b] \longrightarrow {\mathbb{R}} ^d $ smooth enough function, we denote:

\longrightarrow&{({\mathbb{R}}^{d})^{N}}\\
&{Q=(Q_{k})_{k=0,...,N}}&\longmapsto&{\left(\dfrac{1}{h^{\alpha}}\displaystyle%
\sum_{r=0}^{k}\alpha_{r}Q_{k-r}\right)_{k=1,..,N}}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>α</mi></msubsup><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>N</mi></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mi>h</mi><mi>α</mi></msup></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi>k</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>r</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex25.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\Delta^{\alpha}_{+}}:&{({\mathbb{R}}^{d})^{N+1}}&%
\longrightarrow&{({\mathbb{R}}^{d})^{N}}\\
&{Q=(Q_{k})_{k=0,...,N}}&\longmapsto&{\left(\dfrac{1}{h^{\alpha}}\displaystyle%
\sum_{r=0}^{N-k}\alpha_{r}Q_{k+r}\right)_{k=0,..,N-1}.}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>α</mi></msubsup><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>N</mi></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mi>h</mi><mi>α</mi></msup></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>r</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex26.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{array}[t]{lrcl}{\mathcal{L}^{\sigma,\alpha}_{h}}:&{\left({\mathbb{R}}^{%
d}\right)^{N+1}}&\longrightarrow&{{\mathbb{R}}}\\
&{Q=(Q_{k})_{k=0,...,N}}&\longmapsto&{h{\displaystyle}\sum_{k\in I_{\sigma}}L(%
Q_{k},(-\sigma\Delta^{\alpha}_{\sigma}Q)_{k},t_{k}).}\end{array}" display="block"><mtable align="bottom1" columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mi>h</mi><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>:</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="right"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟶</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mi>ℝ</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mo>⟼</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>σ</mi></msub></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi><mi>α</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex27.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}\frac{\partial L}{\partial x}(Q,-\sigma\Delta^{\alpha}_{\sigma}Q,\tau)-%
\sigma\Delta^{\alpha}_{-\sigma}(\frac{\partial L}{\partial v}(Q,-\sigma\Delta^%
{\alpha}_{\sigma}Q,\tau))=0,\;\;Q\in({\mathbb{R}}^{d})^{N+1}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi><mi>α</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>τ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mi>α</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>σ</mi><mi>α</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>τ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo rspace="8.1pt">,</mo><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>∈</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>ℝ</mi><mi>d</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>
